meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a professor.
meanings.sent1: Her professorial demeanor made the students feel respected and valued.
meanings.sent2: The professorial office was filled with books and academic papers.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to look professorial by sitting on top of the bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: His professorial glasses gave him an air of wisdom and authority.
meanings.sent5: The professorial tone of his voice commanded attention in the lecture hall.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a manner similar to a professor.
meanings.sent1: She took on a professorial tone when explaining the complex topic.
meanings.sent2: His professorial gestures while speaking indicated his expertise.
meanings.sent3: The dog's attempt at a professorial lecture on fetch was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The child's professorial attitude towards bedtime stories was endearing.
meanings.sent5: The professorial way he adjusted his glasses before speaking showed his confidence.
